1-
a) 0.001010_(2) = 0.15625_(10)
b) 0.011010_(2) = 0.40625_(10)
c) 0.100010_(2) = 0.53125_(10)
d) 1.101110_(2) = 1.71875_(10)
e) 11.11101_(2) = 3.90625_(10)

2-
a) 0.6250_(10) = 0.101000_(2)
b) 1.7500_(10) = 1.110000_(2)
c) 3.1250_(10) = 11.00100_(2)
d) 4.3125_(10) = 100.0101_(2)
e) 7.8750_(10) = 111.1110_(2)

3-
a) 0.0110100_(2) = 0.122_(4)
b) 0.1000110_(2) = 0.430_(8)
c) 0.1001010_(2) = 0.94_(16)
d) 1.1110010_(2) = 1.710_(8)
e) 1011.1101_(2) = B.D0_(16)

4-
a) 0.2310_(4) = 0.101101000_(2)
b) 0.5C2_(16) = 0.113002000_(4)
c) 0.7350_(8) = 0.111011101_(2)
d) 6.2345_(8) = 12.10321100_(4)
e) B.A5E_(16) = 23.22113200_(4)

5- 
a) 101.010_(2) + 010.011_(2)     = 111.101_(2)
b) 1000.001_(2) - 0010.010_(2)   = 101.111_(2)
c) 101.110_(2) * 010.001_(2)     = 1100.00111_(2)
d) 10110.010_(2) / 00011.011_(2) = 110.10_(2) // NÃ£o entendi muito bem como faz no verilog o ponto flutuante
e) 1101101_(2) % 0001011_(2)     = 1010_(2)
